means: 缺乏自信的，露出怯态的

sentence.Network_en: Her conqueror, Senator Pete Wilson, is a diffident, moderate man.
sentence.Network_cn: 击败她的参议员皮特·威尔逊是一个谦卑的温和派人士。

sentence.Network_en: He has a politely diffident manner.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的态度是客气中带有羞怯.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 松松：3天背完GRE难词 ... dignity:n. 尊严, 高贵 35。 diffident:adj. 缺乏自信的 36。 cower:vi. 畏缩, 退缩 37。.
字根字尾构词法.doc - 豆丁网 ... difficult 艰难,费力的 diffident 羞怯的 diffuse 传播,冗长的.
检验美国高中生英文水平的100个单词，你知道几... ... deleterious 有害 diffident 心虚 enervate 衰弱.
英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... confidential a 秘密的，机密的 diffident a 自卑的，胆怯的 perfidy n 不忠实，背叛.

list.abs: the simulation test can study the movement law of pollutant diffusion under the diffident hydrodynamic condition .模拟试验能够更好地研究不同水动力条件下污染物的扩散运移规律。
It was with diffidence and hesitation that I approached this work ., 我是带著懦怯和犹豫接近这部作品的.
His fault is that he ' s too diffident ., 他的过失是太缺乏自信啦.
Don ' t be so diffident about your talents ., 别对自己的才能如此缺乏信心.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'lacking confidence or trust in someone or something'): from Latin diffident- 'failing in trust', from the verb diffidere, from dis- (expressing reversal) + fidere 'to trust'

entry.tran: 羞怯的;胆怯的;缺乏自信的
entry.def: Someone who is diffident is rather shy and does not enjoy talking about themselves or being noticed by other people.

sentences.sentence: "she was diffident when offering a comment on the professor's lecture"
"stood in the doorway diffident and abashed"
"problems that call for bold not timid responses"

auth_sentence.content: But mainly it's because he actually is diffident.
auth_sentence.res_content: But mainly it's because he actually is diffident.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But mainly it's because he actually is diffident.

auth_sentence.content: He can be diffident, but he knows he's on to something.
auth_sentence.res_content: He can be diffident, but he knows he's on to something.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He can be diffident, but he knows he's on to something.

auth_sentence.content: Obama, even now, seems strangely diffident about laying out his wares.
auth_sentence.res_content: Obama, even now, seems strangely diffident about laying out his wares.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Obama, even now, seems strangely diffident about laying out his wares.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 秘[机]密的;表示信任的;担任机密工作的
stems_affixes.word_buile: confident[adj.[of,in]确信的,自信的]+ial……的→相信的人才知道
dif不+fid相信+ent……的→不相信[自己]→自卑的
fid信任,相信,信念+uciary……的→相信的→信托的
in不+fid信任,相信,信念+el→不信宗教的人
perfidy[n.不忠,背叛]+ious……的→perfidious不忠的
af一再+fid信任,相信,信念+avit表名词→一再发誓相信→宣誓书
confide[v.吐露[心事],委托,信赖]+ant人→confidant可以吐露真情的人
confide[v.吐露[心事],委托,信赖]+ence表名词→n.[in]信任;信心,自信;秘密,机密
de去,不+fy=fid信任→不信任→违抗

per假+fid相信+y状态→假相信→不忠诚
con全部+fid相信+e→吐露
de去,不+fy=fid信任→不信任→违抗

stems_affixes.type_exp: 和辅音重复表示"不,否定,分开"
